Now, Aluminium is a high reactive metal. So, what it will do? It will extract oxygen from it. So, obviously, there will be a displacement reaction and it will become Al2O3.

So, what they used to do is, they used to put pieces of hematite and along with it, a metal used to be added. Which metal? Aluminium metal. Which metal? Aluminium. Now, Aluminium is a high reactive metal. So, what it will do? It will extract oxygen from it. So, obviously, there will be a displacement reaction and it will become Al2O3. In the form of plus, iron separates in the form of liquid. And the same liquid iron is dropped from below and the same liquid iron joins the two railway tracks. So, you see in welding, there is a layer of liquid. is liquid iron. Where did it come from? It came from this reaction and we call this reaction as thermite reaction. We are removing iron in molten state. So this is very important. What is its function? It is commonly used in welding railway tracks. and repairing machine parts. This is a thermite reaction. Now I will tell you another process. This is the process of hematite. This is the extraction of hematite. When do we do this? When we need iron in liquid form. When is this mainly used?
